meanings.definition: The quality of a color as determined by its dominant wavelength and purity
meanings.sent1: The chromaticity of the painting was vibrant and eye-catching.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully selected the chromaticity of the flowers in the artwork.
meanings.sent3: The clown's outfit had such a wild chromaticity that it made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The chromaticity of the sunset painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: Her dress had a unique chromaticity that made it stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: The color quality of an object or light source as determined by its dominant wavelength and purity
meanings.sent1: The chromaticity of the LED lights gave the room a futuristic feel.
meanings.sent2: The chromaticity of the gemstone determined its value in the market.
meanings.sent3: The chromaticity of the traffic lights made the intersection look like a rainbow.
meanings.sent4: The chromaticity of the neon sign drew attention from afar.
meanings.sent5: The chromaticity of the fireworks lit up the night sky with bursts of color.
